content.simple-78856-0-0: Vex is the capital city of the district of Hérens in the canton of Valais in Switzerland.

content.normal-7023314-0-0: Vex is a municipality and capital of the district of Hérens in the canton of Valais in Switzerland.
content.normal-7023314-1-0: Vex has an area, as of 2009 , of 13 km2 .
content.normal-7023314-1-1: Of this area, 4.17 km2 or 32.1% is used for agricultural purposes, while 6.17 km2 or 47.5% is forested.
content.normal-7023314-1-2: Of the rest of the land, 1.71 km2 or 13.2% is settled (buildings or roads), 0.07 km2 or 0.5% is either rivers or lakes and 0.87 km2 or 6.7% is unproductive land.
content.normal-7023314-2-0: Of the built up area, housing and buildings made up 7.2% and transportation infrastructure made up 4.8%.
content.normal-7023314-2-1: Out of the forested land, 38.6% of the total land area is heavily forested and 7.7% is covered with orchards or small clusters of trees.
content.normal-7023314-2-2: Of the agricultural land, 0.2% is used for growing crops and 18.3% is pastures, while 2.5% is used for orchards or vine crops and 11.0% is used for alpine pastures.
content.normal-7023314-2-3: All the water in the municipality is flowing water.
content.normal-7023314-2-4: Of the unproductive areas, 5.7% is unproductive vegetation.
content.normal-7023314-3-0: The blazon of the municipal coat of arms is "Azure, a Chevronelle inverted couped Argent between three Mullets of Five of the same and Coupeaux Vert in base."
content.normal-7023314-4-0: Vex has a population (as of December 2017 ) of .
content.normal-7023314-4-1: s of 2008 , 11.3% of the population are resident foreign nationals.
content.normal-7023314-4-2: Over the last 10 years (1999–2009 ) the population has changed at a rate of 23.8%.
content.normal-7023314-4-3: It has changed at a rate of 23% due to migration and at a rate of -0.7% due to births and deaths.
content.normal-7023314-5-0: Most of the population (as of 2000 ) speaks French (1,216 or 92.8%) as their first language, German is the second most common (38 or 2.9%) and Portuguese is the third (30 or 2.3%).
content.normal-7023314-5-1: There are 4 people who speak Italian.
content.normal-7023314-6-0: s of 2008 , the gender distribution of the population was 50.7% male and 49.3% female.
content.normal-7023314-6-1: The population was made up of 724 Swiss men (44.4% of the population) and 103 (6.3%) non-Swiss men.
content.normal-7023314-6-2: There were 721 Swiss women (44.2%) and 83 (5.1%) non-Swiss women.
content.normal-7023314-6-3: Of the population in the municipality 535 or about 40.8% were born in Vex and lived there in 2000.
content.normal-7023314-6-4: There were 350 or 26.7% who were born in the same canton, while 157 or 12.0% were born somewhere else in Switzerland, and 173 or 13.2% were born outside of Switzerland.
content.normal-7023314-7-0: The age distribution of the population (as of 2000 ) is children and teenagers (0–19 years old) make up 24.1% of the population, while adults (20–64 years old) make up 56.9% and seniors (over 64 years old) make up 19%.
content.normal-7023314-8-0: s of 2000 , there were 526 people who were single and never married in the municipality.
content.normal-7023314-8-1: There were 604 married individuals, 126 widows or widowers and 55 individuals who are divorced.
content.normal-7023314-9-0: s of 2000 , there were 514 private households in the municipality, and an average of 2.3 persons per household.
content.normal-7023314-9-1: There were 180 households that consist of only one person and 28 households with five or more people.
content.normal-7023314-9-2: Out of a total of 528 households that answered this question, 34.1% were households made up of just one person and there were 6 adults who lived with their parents.
content.normal-7023314-9-3: Of the rest of the households, there are 129 married couples without children, 169 married couples with children There were 24 single parents with a child or children.
content.normal-7023314-9-4: There were 6 households that were made up of unrelated people and 14 households that were made up of some sort of institution or another collective housing.
content.normal-7023314-10-0: In 2000 there were 626 single family homes (or 72.3% of the total) out of a total of 866 inhabited buildings.
content.normal-7023314-10-1: There were 135 multi-family buildings (15.6%), along with 51 multi-purpose buildings that were mostly used for housing (5.9%) and 54 other use buildings (commercial or industrial) that also had some housing (6.2%).
content.normal-7023314-11-0: In 2000 , a total of 498 apartments (28.4% of the total) were permanently occupied, while 1,186 apartments (67.7%) were seasonally occupied and 69 apartments (3.9%) were empty.
content.normal-7023314-11-1: s of 2009 , the construction rate of new housing units was 15.3 new units per 1000 residents.
content.normal-7023314-12-0: The historical population is given in the following chart: In the 2007 federal election the most popular party was the CVP which received 37.97% of the vote.
content.normal-7023314-12-1: The next three most popular parties were the FDP (21.97%), the SVP (19.71%) and the SP (12.57%).
content.normal-7023314-12-2: In the federal election, a total of 724 votes were cast, and the voter turnout was 68.6%.
content.normal-7023314-13-0: In the 2009 Conseil d'Etat/Staatsrat election a total of 676 votes were cast, of which 41 or about 6.1% were invalid.
content.normal-7023314-13-1: The voter participation was 63.3%, which is much more than the cantonal average of 54.67%.
content.normal-7023314-13-2: In the 2007 Swiss Council of States election a total of 718 votes were cast, of which 52 or about 7.2% were invalid.
content.normal-7023314-13-3: The voter participation was 69.4%, which is much more than the cantonal average of 59.88%.
content.normal-7023314-14-0: s of 2010 , Vex had an unemployment rate of 2.8%.
content.normal-7023314-14-1: s of 2008 , there were 50 people employed in the primary economic sector and about 18 businesses involved in this sector.
content.normal-7023314-14-2: 58 people were employed in the secondary sector and there were 11 businesses in this sector.
content.normal-7023314-14-3: 309 people were employed in the tertiary sector, with 57 businesses in this sector.
content.normal-7023314-14-4: There were 644 residents of the municipality who were employed in some capacity, of which females made up 43.3% of the workforce.
content.normal-7023314-15-0: In 2008 the total number of full-time equivalent jobs was 331.
content.normal-7023314-15-1: The number of jobs in the primary sector was 34, of which 20 were in agriculture and 14 were in forestry or lumber production.
content.normal-7023314-15-2: The number of jobs in the secondary sector was 54 of which 1 was in manufacturing and 53 (98.1%) were in construction.
content.normal-7023314-15-3: The number of jobs in the tertiary sector was 243.
content.normal-7023314-15-4: In the tertiary sector; 42 or 17.3% were in wholesale or retail sales or the repair of motor vehicles, 16 or 6.6% were in the movement and storage of goods, 55 or 22.6% were in a hotel or restaurant, 13 or 5.3% were the insurance or financial industry, 6 or 2.5% were technical professionals or scientists, 10 or 4.1% were in education and 53 or 21.8% were in health care.
content.normal-7023314-16-0: In 2000 , there were 153 workers who commuted into the municipality and 406 workers who commuted away.
content.normal-7023314-16-1: The municipality is a net exporter of workers, with about 2.7 workers leaving the municipality for every one entering.
content.normal-7023314-16-2: Of the working population, 8.9% used public transportation to get to work, and 71.4% used a private car.
content.normal-7023314-17-0: From the 2000 census , 1,047 or 79.9% were Roman Catholic, while 78 or 5.9% belonged to the Swiss Reformed Church.
content.normal-7023314-17-1: Of the rest of the population, there were 5 members of an Orthodox church (or about 0.38% of the population), there was 1 individual who belongs to the Christian Catholic Church, and there was 1 individual who belongs to another Christian church.
content.normal-7023314-17-2: There was 1 individual who was Jewish, and 4 (or about 0.31% of the population) who were Islamic.
content.normal-7023314-17-3: There was 1 person who was Buddhist and 1 individual who belonged to another church.
content.normal-7023314-17-4: 57 (or about 4.35% of the population) belonged to no church, are agnostic or atheist, and 115 individuals (or about 8.77% of the population) did not answer the question.
content.normal-7023314-18-0: In Vex about 448 or (34.2%) of the population have completed non-mandatory upper secondary education, and 125 or (9.5%) have completed additional higher education (either university or a "Fachhochschule").
content.normal-7023314-18-1: Of the 125 who completed tertiary schooling, 57.6% were Swiss men, 28.8% were Swiss women, 7.2% were non-Swiss men and 6.4% were non-Swiss women.
content.normal-7023314-18-2: s of 2000 , there were 25 students in Vex who came from another municipality, while 69 residents attended schools outside the municipality.
content.normal-7023314-19-0: Vex is home to the "Bibliothèque de Vex" library.
content.normal-7023314-19-1: The library has (as of 2008 ) 4,671 books or other media, and loaned out 6,911 items in the same year.
content.normal-7023314-19-2: It was open a total of 79 days with average of 6 hours per week during that year.
